intro: Leucas royleoides, commonly known as the Himalayan blue poppy, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of the Himalayas. It is characterized by its striking blue to violet petals and is part of the Papaveraceae family. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at high altitudes. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
